entity_resolver.core.evaluator module¶

Contains only one evaluator class to be used by the main module

Example

>>> from entity_resolver.core import Evaluator
>>> evaluator = Evaluator(strategy='ami')  # AMI score
>>> score = evaluator.evaluate(labels, preds)
class entity_resolver.core.evaluator.Evaluator(strategy='precision_recall', verbose=0, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: entity_resolver.core.utils.WithLogger

An evaluator class for entity resolution evaluation.

Parameters

  • strategy (Union[str, Callable]) – The strategy name to be used for evaluation of the entity resolution performance. It is the same as evaluator_strategy attribute of EntityResolver.

  • verbose (int) – Indicate how much information to be logged/printed in the console during the program execution. It is the same as verbose attribute of EntityResolver.

  • **kwargs – Additional keyword arguments that are only used in specific cases. Only average_method is a useful keyword here. Refer to the kwargs parameter of EntityResolver for details.

strategy[source]¶

Same as strategy in the above parameters section.

Type

Union[str, Callable]

kwargs[source]¶

Same as kwargs in the above parameters section.

_strategy_funcs[source]¶

This is a class attribute registering how each strategy string is associated with a evaluation function.

Type

Dict[str, Callable[[Mapping, OrderedDict], Any]]

_strategy_funcs = {'ami': <bound method ClusteringMetrics.ami of <class 'entity_resolver.core.utils.ClusteringMetrics'>>, 'precision_recall': <bound method ClusteringMetrics.precision_recall of <class 'entity_resolver.core.utils.ClusteringMetrics'>>, 'v_measure': <bound method ClusteringMetrics.v_measure of <class 'entity_resolver.core.utils.ClusteringMetrics'>>}[source]
evaluate(labels, preds)[source]¶

Evaluate the performance given predicted results and ground truth.

Parameters

  • labels (Mapping) – Mapping reference ids to cluster ids. The cluster ids may be different from those in the ground truth.

  • preds (OrderedDict) – Mapping reference ids to cluster ids. The dictionary is sorted (key-value pairs are inserted) in ascending order of reference ids.

Return type

Any

Returns

Something that represents the performance of the entity resolution by applying the strategy_func property. Refer to the attribute documentation for possible returns.

property strategy_func[source]¶

Callable[[Mapping, OrderedDict], Any]: A strategy function that returns something that represents the performance of the entity resolution. After instantiation

  • If strategy is set to 'ami', or 'v_measure', the return type is a single float representing the score.

  • If strategy is set to 'precision_recall' (default), the return type is Tuple[float, float, float] representing precision, recall, and f1 scores in the order. Refer to Advanced Guide for more details.
